intro: Hedyotis graminicola, commonly known as the grassy dotweed, is a small herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a reddish or purple tinge. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, three-lobed berries.
